summary: This document is a record of a Twitter exchange from August 14, 2019, where Mrs. Christine Assange, mother of Julian Assange, publicly refutes an unconfirmed report claiming her son is dead. She confirms he is alive and suggests the rumor is an attempt to undermine efforts to free him.

persons.name: Christine Assange
persons.role: Mother of Julian Assange, Twitter user
persons.context: Identifies herself as the mother of Julian Assange and publicly confirms on Twitter that he is not dead, countering a rumor.

persons.name: Julian Assange
persons.context: Subject of an unconfirmed death rumor on social media; his mother confirms he is alive. Described as being politically persecuted and tortured for his journalism.

persons.name: Christopher Greene
persons.context: Twitter user who posted the unconfirmed report indicating Julian Assange might be dead, which prompted the response from Christine Assange.

persons.name: Charlotte Gracias
persons.context: Appears as another participant in the Twitter thread, replying to Christine Assange's post.

connections.description: Christine Assange is the mother of Julian Assange, as stated in her Twitter bio and reply.
Christine Assange directly replies to Christopher Greene's tweet to refute his claim about Julian Assange's death.
Charlotte Gracias replies to Christine Assange's tweet in the same thread.

events.title: Death rumor about Julian Assange circulated and refuted
events.description: An unconfirmed report on Twitter claimed Julian Assange was dead. His mother, Christine Assange, publicly replied to confirm he was alive and suggested the rumor was a tactic to undermine efforts to free him.

keyFacts: On August 14, 2019, an unconfirmed social media report claimed Julian Assange was dead.
Christine Assange, Julian's mother, publicly confirmed on Twitter that her son was not dead.
Christine Assange suggested the death rumor was spread by 'unscrupulous operatives' to undermine global efforts to free Julian Assange.
The document is a record of this specific Twitter exchange, captured as part of the Epstein case document set.
